caseStudies.name: Garvey Disposal
caseStudies.description: Garbage collection and waste management service serving both residential scatter customers and HOA contract accounts.
growthRecommendations: Fix unit economics through route efficiency and asset utilization
Focus on one avatar first (HOA for LTV, Scatter for quick cash flow)
Restructure offer for upfront cash >= CAC + first-month fulfillment
Build commission-only door-to-door sales team
Position on efficiency, not price, to avoid commoditized bidding
formulasApplied: Unit Economics: Revenue must exceed CAC + COGS
Route Efficiency: Utilization % drives margin recovery
LTV:CAC Ratio: HOA contracts support high CAC investment

caseStudies.name: AC Styles
caseStudies.description: Personal styling and fashion consulting service with recurring monthly and quarterly retainer packages.
primaryConstraints: Lead volume is the bottleneck (not economics)
Conversion issue: high clicks but low sales ratio (1,800 clicks = 8 sales)
Need better lead magnet to improve opt-in rate
growthRecommendations: Validate and scale demand through better lead magnet (target 30%+ opt-in)
Maintain core offer; economics are already healthy
Focus on avatar definition and trigger moments (life events: new job, divorce, etc.)
Implement lead-scoring to focus on high-LTV buyers
Double down on best-performing channels (audit source mix)
formulasApplied: LTV:CAC Ratio: 16.7:1 indicates economics are solid
Churn Analysis: 2.5% annual churn is excellent (1 lost from 40)
Offer Ladder: Onboarding + recurring revenue model works well

caseStudies.name: Kyo Chiropractic Chain
caseStudies.description: Multi-location chiropractic practice with 6 brick-and-mortar locations, insurance-based billing, and package pricing.
primaryConstraints: Sales infrastructure around insurance verification needed
Close rate significantly above average (71% vs healthy 30-40%)
Pricing may be undervalued given high close rates
growthRecommendations: Scale high-intent channels first: Google Ads and Local SEO
Test higher price points given 71% close rate
Reduce lead leakage in discovery process
Optimize location-specific performance
Consider expanding to new locations with proven model
formulasApplied: Google ROAS: $1 spend = $24 return
Location Scaling: Unit economics support multi-location expansion
Pricing Optimization: 71% close rate suggests room for price increase

caseStudies.name: Trophy Outlet
caseStudies.description: Hybrid business combining product sales (trophies, awards) with engraving and customization services.
primaryConstraints: Low margin (6.4%) typical for retail-product mix
growthRecommendations: Identify and expand high-margin service components
Shift to B2B corporate award programs (higher LTV)
Build recurring subscription model for corporate clients
Reduce retail transaction volume, increase average order value
formulasApplied: Product vs Service Mix: Shift mix toward higher-margin services

caseStudies.name: Unfiltered Hospitality
caseStudies.description: Bar and beverage consulting service helping hospitality venues optimize operations, menu, and revenue.
growthRecommendations: Transition to recurring retainer model vs project fees
Build systematic implementation playbook to reduce delivery time
Create partnership model with larger hospitality groups
Develop 'done-for-you' package for highest-margin clients
formulasApplied: Consulting to Recurring: Convert project revenue to retainer
Implementation Leverage: Scale delivery through systems and team

caseStudies.name: Legal Services for Musicians
caseStudies.description: Specialized legal services focused on music industry clients, contracts, rights, and business formation.
primaryConstraints: Likely high cost of client acquisition for niche vertical
growthRecommendations: Restructure pricing to support margin target (30%+)
Focus on highest-value services (contract negotiation, rights management)
Build productized offerings: music contract templates, rights bundles
Create recurring legal retainer for active musicians and labels
Reduce delivery cost through leverage (templates, systems)
formulasApplied: Service to Product: Convert hourly/project work to productized packages
Pricing Restructure: Unit economics must improve before scaling

caseStudies.name: Amy Lash and Beauty
caseStudies.description: Eyelash extensions and beauty services chain with multiple locations and recurring client base.
growthRecommendations: Systematize technician training and quality standards
Build subscription model for regular lash maintenance
Expand to adjacent beauty services (nails, brows)
Implement retention marketing for lash refills
Develop franchising model for expansion
formulasApplied: Recurring Revenue: Subscription lash packages
Location Scaling: Proven model supports chain expansion
Service Upsells: Leverage existing client base for add-on services

caseStudies.name: Basil & Co Thai Restaurant
caseStudies.description: Full-service Thai restaurant with dine-in, takeout, and potential delivery channels.
growthRecommendations: Systematize operations to reduce labor % of revenue
Develop catering and corporate meal programs (higher margin)
Build ghost kitchen operation for delivery-only channels
Create meal subscription or loyalty program
Test additional locations in adjacent markets
formulasApplied: Channel Mix Optimization: Prioritize high-margin channels (catering vs delivery)
Operational Leverage: Systems reduce labor % as volume increases
Location Replication: Proven model supports multi-unit expansion

verticals.name: Waste Management
verticals.description: Trash collection, recycling, junk removal services with both residential and commercial avatars.

verticals.name: Personal Styling
verticals.description: Fashion consulting, wardrobe management, personal shopping, and styling retainers.
characteristics: Low churn when service is excellent

verticals.name: Health & Fitness Services
verticals.description: Chiropractic, personal training, wellness coaching, and physical therapy services.
characteristics: High close rates when positioned correctly

verticals.name: Hybrid Retail + Service
verticals.description: Businesses combining product sales with service delivery (awards + engraving, products + customization).
characteristics: Opportunity to shift to service-heavy model

verticals.name: Hospitality & Beverage
verticals.description: Bar consulting, restaurant operations, beverage programs, and hospitality optimization.

verticals.name: Professional Services
verticals.description: Legal, accounting, consulting, and advisory services for specialized niches.
characteristics: Opportunity: Recurring retainers vs hourly billing

verticals.name: Beauty & Personal Care
verticals.description: Salons, lash extensions, aesthetics, spas, and beauty treatment services.
characteristics: Strong client loyalty when quality is consistent

verticals.name: Food Service & Restaurants
verticals.description: Full-service restaurants, quick service, catering, and food delivery services.
